title: Online Synchronous Microlearning for Collaborative Problem-Solving (CPS) Pattern Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Professionals in medical/legal/technical fields learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments with intermediate expertise in mathematics

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the spatiotemporal characteristics of CPS processes using online synchronous chat tools
Learners can classify CPS patterns into two types by applying a clustering method based on Dynamic Time Warping (DTW).
Learners can evaluate collaborative problem-solving strategies from an integrated perspective of metacognitive, cognitive, and social communication dimensions.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
